newsitem.title: USA: Bail for Avant! officials set at $100,000.
newsitem.headline: Bail for Avant! officials set at $100,000.

text.p: Bail was set at $100,000 each for top executives at Avant! Corp who face felony charges for allegedly stealing Cadence Design Systems Inc technology, a prosecutor said Tuesday.
Santa Clara County, Calif., Deputy District Attorney Julius Finkelstein said arrest warrants were issued for all of the defendants and bail was set at $100,000 each.
Finkelstein said he expected the top Avant! executives to surrender for booking later Tuesday. "I anticipate they will be posting bail," he said.

On Monday, the district attorney's office alleged that Avant!, its president and other senior officials misappropriated Cadence's Symbad, Froute, Groute, Qplace and Vsize technologies, and "then used that stolen technology to develop and market competing products."
"You have a major publicly-traded company that appears to be founded on stolen technology," Finkelstein said.

Charges of conspiracy and theft of trade secrets were filed against Avant! president and director Gerald Hsu, vice president of engineering Stephen Tzyh-Lih Wuu, vice president of technology Yuh-Zen Liao and director Yun-Chung Eric Cho.
The charges were also filed against Avant! employee Chih-Liang Eric Cheng; director of business operations Shiaoli Leigh Huang; and Mitsuru Igusa, according to prosecutors.
All of the officials charged were former employees of Cadence Design Systems.
Avant! and Cadence have been bitter rivals for years. They both sell software that helps engineers design the intricate layouts of computer chips.
For more than a year, Cadence has been pressing its own civil action against Avant!, alleging its rival stole some of its programming codes and used them in its own products.
